entry.title: If you like your coffee hot (let me be your coffee pot)
entry.summary:
Author: emme

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,769Chapters: 5/6Kudos: 139

Summary: Batman didn’t sleep; he didn’t rest, nor did he take breaks. He didn’t acknowledge his injuries, his weaknesses, or his limitations. Batman was the night, and the night is relentless, unforgiving, unstoppable.Bruce, on the other hand… he didn’t sleep, he didn’t rest, nor did he take breaks either, but he desperately needed to. Clark couldn’t do much about that. He couldn’t very well force the man to take a nap (even if sometimes he wished he could just push him down on a flat surface, effectively close his eyes, and order him to sleep). What he could do, however, was ensure Bruce kept an adequate energy level, the kind of energy level that allows a human being to stand upright, walk, talk, and generally survive life with minimal discomfort.He… fed him. Clark fed him whenever he could.The situation was not spiraling out of control. He could very well handle things, and “acts of service” was not Superman’s love language. It was not.Or:Five times Clark brought food to Bruce and one time he didn’t have to, but he did it anyway.

entry.title: Peter and The Gang™ in Gotham
entry.summary:
Author: MichaelWitha_B

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 36,950Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 102

Summary: Spider-Man and a couple of his close friends have been looking for a very annoying villain. A very villainous villain. The evilest of evil... You get the point. Well, said villain has this crazy tool that well... kills them. All of them. Even villain guy. BUT luckily, said mysterious tool somehow transports them to *drum roll* GOTHAM CITY. YAHOO!!! No cheers? Well I'm cheering anyway *pinky finger flips you off*Simply put, it's my own twist to the Peter in Gotham fics that includes SpideyPool and a couple of my fav boys (and gals).

entry.title: Baternity Leave
entry.summary:
Author: Gentlefolk_fica

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,573Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 774

Summary: Disbelieving what he was looking at, he turned back to the computer across the cold stone expanse.“Computer- analyze results.”The computer downloaded the ultrasound data and cross-referenced it with his other symptoms.“Additional heartbeat detected. Fetal life form present. Estimated: 7-8 weeks gestation”Bruce blinked again. Ever the logical one when faced with a crisis, he asked: “Any additional data?”“Kryptonian DNA detected.”That’s when Bruce gave himself permission to panic.

entry.title: Attention (is the beginning of devotion)
entry.summary:
Author: Dopamine_Knight

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,286Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 118

Summary: .Bruce Wayne is a man of many secrets. His identity as Batman, the falsity of Brucie Wayne, his one-sided love that caused the fall of Gotham’s White Knight... And a current, silly crush that is not as bad as Selina makes it to be. He knows Clark Kent’s only secret: he is Superman. He tries to guard this secret as close as he can to his chest, but one night he slips. And he thinks he’s just made Clark’s hatred of him all the more justifiable. ...But does he? Does Kal-El have only one secret, after all? .

entry.title: As Though the Sun Will Never Set
entry.summary:
Author: Scarlet609

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 37,573Chapters: 4/65Kudos: 95

Summary: Bruce Wayne has done something to get him sent to live with the Kents, he thought it would be mundane and unfulfilling, but he soon finds himself caught between something dangerous and wonderful. There are factions moving in to claim his prize, his newly found trump card and he's not ready to let it go.Enter Clark, the soft-spoken Kansas farm boy, just a little too wholesome, a little too comfortable with cows and crickets and just a little too strong for his own good.As Bruce enters the plotters and begins weaving his web of seduction and treachery, mundanity seems further and further away, slipping through Clark's fingers.ORThe one in which they are both trapped and enslaved by Clark's growing sexual desire and his alien physiology. entry.title: Operation: Sleep Well, Destroy Better
entry.summary:
Author: Hasunohana

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,558Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 143

Summary: Clark Kent's marriage to Bruce Wayne threw him straight into the chaos of the Batfam—a den of chronic insomnia and neglected self-care. Determined to enforce at least a bare minimum of healthy routine, Clark declared war on sleepless nights and diets of pure black coffee.Some accepted the changes reluctantly. But Tim Drake? Tim was a whole other challenge.After countless failed attempts to convince him to take better care of himself, Clark decided to fight dirty. The offer? 90 days of regulated sleep and less coffee in exchange for a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity—to humiliate Lex Luthor.Now, the looming question: Will Tim hold up his end of the deal, or will his work obsession (and caffeine addiction) sabotage his own revenge?

entry.title: First Light
entry.summary:
Author: lighthouse_inkwell

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,088Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 125

Summary: Bruce Wayne is overwhelmed.In trying to get initiatives off the ground that will actually improve Gotham's infrastructure, he unwillingly goes on a press tour in Metropolis, where he is met with increasingly personal questions about his reappearance into society, and of course (as always) his parents tragic deaths. Panic attacks ensue, Bruce meets a particularly polite reporter who talks him out of it, but is met with a brand new problem when a miscommunication leads the public into thinking Bruce is dating said reporter.Clark convinces Bruce that answering questions about a fake relationship would be leagues easier than answering questions about dead parents. Bruce agrees. And totally not because Clark has the most charming smiling he's ever seen.

entry.summary:
Author: hoeforhoran28

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,919Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 696

Summary: "Your identity was supposed to be a secret. Not only to protect yourself (and probably least importantly yourself) but others. Your family, your friends. Everyone who stood a chance at being ripped apart by your decision to go out there everyday and put yourself in the crossfire.Not that Bruce had anyone to protect, besides Alfred. But it was still a fucking given."Or: Bruce has been Batman for two years and if he knew anything, it was that when you don a mask, you don it for a reason. An important reason that just doesn't seem to be as important to the rest of the League as it is to him. This is going to be a story about Bruce being coaxed into allowing others behind his carefully built walls. (Specifically one person.)
